relations.content: Horace H. Rackham and Mary A. Rackham Fund
University of Michigan. Dept. of History.

resource.source:
<objectXMLWrap>
               <did xmlns="urn:isbn:1-931666-22-9">
                  <origination>
                     <corpname>Horace H. Rackham and Mary A. Rackham Fund</corpname>
                  </origination>
                  <unittitle>Horace H. Rackham and Mary A. Rackham Fund Records
<unitdate>1929-1950</unitdate>
                     <unitdate>1934-1940</unitdate>
                  </unittitle>
                  <physdesc>
                     <extent>14 linear feet and 1 oversize volume</extent>
                  </physdesc>
                  <abstract>The last will and testament of Horace H. Rackham provided for the establishment of a trust fund to provide for the health and welfare of  individuals, particularly the sick, aged, the young, the poor, and other underprivileged.  Much of the trust money went to the University of Michigan to be used for a building for the graduate school and an endowment to be used for different kinds of research.  The Fund also awarded grants to agencies involved in child welfare, community culture, education, health, philanthropy, and science.  The Fund distributed money from 1934 until about 1941.  The series in this record group consist of administrative and executive files, and project applications and grant files.</abstract>
                  <unitid>851587 Bs 2</unitid>
                  <langmaterial>The materials are in <language>English.</language>
                  </langmaterial>
                  <repository>
                     <corpname>
                        <subarea>Bentley Historical Library</subarea> University of Michigan</corpname>
                     <extptr/>
                  </repository>
               </did>
            </objectXMLWrap>
resource.title: Horace H. Rackham and Mary A. Rackham Fund Records 1929-1950 1934-1940
resource.abstract: The last will and testament of Horace H. Rackham provided for the establishment of a trust fund to provide for the health and welfare of  individuals, particularly the sick, aged, the young, the poor, and other underprivileged.  Much of the trust money went to the University of Michigan to be used for a building for the graduate school and an endowment to be used for different kinds of research.  The Fund also awarded grants to agencies involved in child welfare, community culture, education, health, philanthropy, and science.  The Fund distributed money from 1934 until about 1941.  The series in this record group consist of administrative and executive files, and project applications and grant files.
resource.displayEntry: Horace H. Rackham and Mary A. Rackham Fund Records, 1929-1950, 1934-1940

nameEntries.original: Bentley Historical Library , University of Michigan

resourceRelations.content: Horace H. Rackham and Mary A. Rackham Fund Records, 1929-1950, 1934-1940

resource.source:
<objectXMLWrap>
               <did xmlns="urn:isbn:1-931666-22-9">
                  <origination>
                     <persname>Hankinson, Thomas Leroy, 1876-1935</persname>
                  </origination>
                  <unittitle>

Thomas L. Hankinson Papers 
<unitdate>

1899-1935</unitdate>
                  </unittitle>
                  <physdesc>
                     <extent>

8 linear feet (10 boxes)</extent>
                  </physdesc>
                  <unitid>

851398 Aa 2</unitid>
                  <langmaterial>The material is in <language>English</language>
                  </langmaterial>
                  <abstract>

Naturalist, professor of zoology and physiology at Eastern Illinois State Normal College and Michigan State Normal College, and researcher for state conservation departments in Michigan and Ohio. Correspondence, reports, and field and laboratory notes concerning his studies of the fish of Michigan, Illinois and New York; also photographs.
</abstract>
                  <repository>
                     <corpname>
                        <subarea>Bentley Historical Library</subarea>, University of Michigan</corpname>
                     <extptr/>
                  </repository>
               </did>
            </objectXMLWrap>
resource.title: Thomas L. Hankinson Papers 1899-1935
resource.abstract: Naturalist, professor of zoology and physiology at Eastern Illinois State Normal College and Michigan State Normal College, and researcher for state conservation departments in Michigan and Ohio. Correspondence, reports, and field and laboratory notes concerning his studies of the fish of Michigan, Illinois and New York; also photographs.

resource.source:
<objectXMLWrap>
               <did xmlns="urn:isbn:1-931666-22-9">
                  <origination>
                     <persname>

Green, Fred Warren, 1872-1936.
</persname>
                  </origination>
                  <unittitle>

Fred W. Green papers 
<unitdate>

1881-1939
</unitdate>
                  </unittitle>
                  <physdesc>
                     <extent>

2.5 linear ft. (in 3 boxes), 4 oversize volumes, and 1 oversize folder
</extent>
                  </physdesc>
                  <unitid>

851410 Aa 2; AC; Ac
</unitid>
                  <langmaterial>The material is in <language>English</language>
                  </langmaterial>
                  <abstract>

Republican Governor of Michigan, 1927-1930, from Ionia.  Correspondence and other papers, 1898-1936, concerning the Spanish-American War, Republican politics, and personal affairs; and scrapbooks, 1896-1929, covering his political career and election campaigns; and photographs.</abstract>
                  <repository>
                     <corpname>
                        <subarea>Bentley Historical Library</subarea>, University of Michigan</corpname>
                     <extptr/>
                  </repository>
               </did>
            </objectXMLWrap>
resource.title: Fred W. Green papers 1881-1939
resource.abstract: Republican Governor of Michigan, 1927-1930, from Ionia.  Correspondence and other papers, 1898-1936, concerning the Spanish-American War, Republican politics, and personal affairs; and scrapbooks, 1896-1929, covering his political career and election campaigns; and photographs.
resource.extent: 2.5 linear ft. (in 3 boxes), 4 oversize volumes, and 1 oversize folder

resource.source:
<objectXMLWrap>
               <mods xmlns="http://www.loc.gov/mods/v3">
                  <recordInfo>
                     <recordOrigin>WorldCat:609585712</recordOrigin>
                     <recordContentSource>ISIL:OCLC-EXW</recordContentSource>
                  </recordInfo>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>Adams, Kathleen,</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/cre">Creator</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
                  <titleInfo>
                     <title>Kathleen Adams collection, 1930-1953.</title>
                  </titleInfo>
                  <abstract>Matilda Sophia Abel papers include credit evaluation slip and credit adjustment blank from Western State Teachers College, 1941, renewal of Western State Normal rural school certificate, 1910-1913, Michigan State Normal College orthopedic certificate, 1930, Michigan Education Association honor award, 1953, diploma from Western State Normal School (Life certificate), 1923 and diploma from Western Michigan College of Education, Bachelor of Science, 1943. Bert Adams papers include Western Michigan College of Education teacher certificate, 1936, 1950, Western State Teachers College, State secondary provisional certificate, 1940, Student's credit book (unofficial), 1934-1938, diploma from Western State Teachers College, Bachelor of Science, 1940. </abstract>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>Western Michigan University</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/rps">Repository</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
               </mods>
            </objectXMLWrap>
resource.title: Kathleen Adams collection, 1930-1953.
resource.abstract: Matilda Sophia Abel papers include credit evaluation slip and credit adjustment blank from Western State Teachers College, 1941, renewal of Western State Normal rural school certificate, 1910-1913, Michigan State Normal College orthopedic certificate, 1930, Michigan Education Association honor award, 1953, diploma from Western State Normal School (Life certificate), 1923 and diploma from Western Michigan College of Education, Bachelor of Science, 1943. Bert Adams papers include Western Michigan College of Education teacher certificate, 1936, 1950, Western State Teachers College, State secondary provisional certificate, 1940, Student's credit book (unofficial), 1934-1938, diploma from Western State Teachers College, Bachelor of Science, 1940.

<objectXMLWrap>

                  <recordInfo>
                     <recordOrigin>WorldCat:154302331</recordOrigin>
                     <recordContentSource>ISIL:OCLC-BEU</recordContentSource>
                  </recordInfo>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>Sherzer, William Hittell, 1860-</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/cre">Creator</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>Hall, James Parker, 1871-1928.</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/cre">Creator</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>Hubbard, Bela, 1814-1896.</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/cre">Creator</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>Hubbard, Lucius L. (Lucius Lee), 1849-1933</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/cre">Creator</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>Lane, Alfred C. (Alfred Church), b. 1863.</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/cre">Creator</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>Roth, Filibert, 1858-1925.</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/cre">Creator</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
                  <titleInfo>
                     <title>William Hittell Sherzer papers, 1874-1929.</title>
                  </titleInfo>
                  <abstract>Correspondence, manuscript articles, notes and other papers largely relating to his interest and scholarly activities in the field of geology; also scattered items of correspondence of Bela Hubbard, five volumes of geological field notes, 1896, on Monroe and Wayne Counties, Michigan, and a University of Michigan M.A. thesis.  Correspondents include: James Hall, Bela Hubbard, Lucius L. Hubbard, Alfred C. Lane, and Filibert Roth. </abstract>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>University of Michigan</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/rps">Repository</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
               </mods>
            </objectXMLWrap>
resource.title: William Hittell Sherzer papers, 1874-1929.
resource.abstract: Correspondence, manuscript articles, notes and other papers largely relating to his interest and scholarly activities in the field of geology; also scattered items of correspondence of Bela Hubbard, five volumes of geological field notes, 1896, on Monroe and Wayne Counties, Michigan, and a University of Michigan M.A. thesis.  Correspondents include: James Hall, Bela Hubbard, Lucius L. Hubbard, Alfred C. Lane, and Filibert Roth.
resource.displayEntry: Sherzer, William Hittell, 1860-. William Hittell Sherzer papers, 1874-1929.

resource.source:
<objectXMLWrap>
               <did xmlns="urn:isbn:1-931666-22-9">
                  <origination>
                     <persname>Lunden, Herman, 1859-1929.</persname>
                  </origination>
                  <unittitle>Herman Lunden Papers
<unitdate>1896-1929</unitdate>
                  </unittitle>
                  <physdesc>
                     <extent>5.5 linear feet.</extent>
                  </physdesc>
                  <abstract>Timber manager of the Kneeland Bigelow Company of Bay City, Michigan. Autobiography; correspondence, 1899-1924 (scattered); Kneeland-Bigelow Company records, 1912 and 1923-1929; subject files relating to his interest in conservation, reforestation, forest fire prevention, local Republican party affairs, road improvement, and the development of the northern Lower Peninsula as a tourist and recreational region.</abstract>
                  <unitid>85276 Aa 2</unitid>
                  <langmaterial>The materials are in <language>English.</language>
                  </langmaterial>
                  <repository>
                     <corpname>
                        <subarea>Bentley Historical Library</subarea> University of Michigan</corpname>
                     <extptr/>
                  </repository>
               </did>
            </objectXMLWrap>
resource.title: Herman Lunden Papers 1896-1929
resource.abstract: Timber manager of the Kneeland Bigelow Company of Bay City, Michigan. Autobiography; correspondence, 1899-1924 (scattered); Kneeland-Bigelow Company records, 1912 and 1923-1929; subject files relating to his interest in conservation, reforestation, forest fire prevention, local Republican party affairs, road improvement, and the development of the northern Lower Peninsula as a tourist and recreational region.

</extent>

                  <unitid>

8821 Bimu C26 2
</unitid>
                  <langmaterial>The material is in <language>English</language>
                  </langmaterial>
                  <abstract>

Student papers, 1930-1987 prepared for classes in history at the University of Michigan (primarily Michigan history class taught by Lewis G. VanderVelde, but also including research papers for classes taught by Sidney Fine and others); topics concern Michigan social and political history; Michigan biography and bibliography; and local community history.
</abstract>
                  <repository>
                     <corpname>
                        <subarea>Bentley Historical Library</subarea>, University of Michigan</corpname>
                     <extptr/>
                  </repository>
               </did>
            </objectXMLWrap>

VanderVelde, but also including research papers for classes taught by Sidney Fine and others); topics concern Michigan social and political history; Michigan biography and bibliography; and local community history.

resource.source:
<objectXMLWrap>
               <mods xmlns="http://www.loc.gov/mods/v3">
                  <recordInfo>
                     <recordOrigin>WorldCat:427647699</recordOrigin>
                     <recordContentSource>ISIL:OCLC-EXW</recordContentSource>
                  </recordInfo>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>Jones, Clarice Platt,</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/cre">Creator</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>Chauncey, A. E.</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/cre">Creator</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
                  <titleInfo>
                     <title>Clarice Platt Jones collection, 1807-1968.</title>
                  </titleInfo>
                  <abstract>Family papers of the Jacob and Sophia Barth family include information about Charles Barth; the Carmody family; the Sullivan family; the McNutt family; and the Umphrey family. Papers about life in Berrien County, Michigan and Chicago, Illinois,  with letters from Germany, Ireland, Florida, and Arizona. Typescript biography of Sophia Barth Weber with family charts. Berrien County, A Nineteenth Century Story, by A. E. Chauncey, privately printed, 1955.  The Bridal Souvenir, by Rev. Samuel Cutler, American Tract Society, New York, 1892, belonging to B. R. Platt and Minnie M. McNutt. Material about the Coloma Lodge No. 140, Coloma, Michigan; Carmody Brothers Store, Watervliet, Michigan. Two letters from Theodore Roosevelt, one addressed to Maj. C. G. Barth, undated, the second addressed to Charles Barth, 13 May1916. Certificates, diplomas, and school related items. </abstract>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>Western Michigan University</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/rps">Repository</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
               </mods>
            </objectXMLWrap>
resource.title: Clarice Platt Jones collection, 1807-1968.
resource.abstract: Family papers of the Jacob and Sophia Barth family include information about Charles Barth; the Carmody family; the Sullivan family; the McNutt family; and the Umphrey family. Papers about life in Berrien County, Michigan and Chicago, Illinois,  with letters from Germany, Ireland, Florida, and Arizona. Typescript biography of Sophia Barth Weber with family charts. Berrien County, A Nineteenth Century Story, by A. E. Chauncey, privately printed, 1955.  The Bridal Souvenir, by Rev. Samuel Cutler, American Tract Society, New York, 1892, belonging to B. R. Platt and Minnie M. McNutt. Material about the Coloma Lodge No. 140, Coloma, Michigan; Carmody Brothers Store, Watervliet, Michigan. Two letters from Theodore Roosevelt, one addressed to Maj. C. G. Barth, undated, the second addressed to Charles Barth, 13 May1916. Certificates, diplomas, and school related items.
resource.displayEntry: Jones, Clarice Platt,. Clarice Platt Jones collection, 1807-1968.
